When did pinball become kind of a social no-no?
That was actually pretty early.
A company called Bally invented a payout game and once these games were invented, that was gambling.
So pinball was outlawed in the three major cities that were important for pinball.
That was New York City, that was Chicago and that was L.A.
But not until 1976 did they finally legalize pinball in New York City.
